part2.question:
Describe a book you read that you found useful. You should say:
What it is
When you read it
Why you think it is useful
And explain how you felt about it.
part2.model_answer: I recently finished reading a self-help book called 'Atomic Habits', which was incredibly Educational [有教育意义的]. It taught me how to build better routines. Since it was such a Page-turner [引人入胜的书], I finished it in two days, although I am usually a slow reader. The advice was Thought-provoking [发人深省的] and practical. I found the examples very Captivating [迷人的]. It is a Classic [经典的] in the personal development genre [类型]. It was a Memorable [难忘的] read that changed my life. I didn't Lose oneself in [沉迷于...] a fantasy world, but I improved my reality. I highly recommend [推荐] it.

part2.question:
Describe a story you read or heard recently. You should say:
What the story was about
Where you read or heard it
Who the main characters were
And explain why this story stayed in your memory.
part2.model_answer: I want to share a science fiction story I read online that was truly Captivating [迷人的]. It was about a future where robots have feelings. Because the plot was so Thought-provoking [发人深省的], I couldn't stop thinking about it, which made it very Memorable [难忘的] for me. It wasn't a Classic [经典的] novel, but a modern short story. I tend to Lose oneself in [沉迷于...] these kinds of tales. It was definitely a Page-turner [引人入胜的书]. The ending was surprising and Educational [有教育意义的] about human nature. I realized you can't Judge a book by its cover [以貌取人] or a story by its length. It was fantastic.

part2.question:
Describe a traditional story from your country. You should say:
What the story is
When you first heard it
What moral lesson it teaches
And explain why it is still popular today.
part2.model_answer: I would like to tell you about the Legend of the White Snake, which is a Classic [经典的] Chinese folktale. It is a very Memorable [难忘的] love story between a human and a snake spirit. Although it is an ancient myth, the themes are still Thought-provoking [发人深省的] today, because true love faces many obstacles. It is Educational [有教育意义的] regarding our cultural values. The story is so Captivating [迷人的] that it has been made into many TV shows. You can easily Lose oneself in [沉迷于...] the magical world it describes. It is a real Page-turner [引人入胜的书] if you read the novel version. It represents our history and romantic spirit perfectly.

part3.question: What should the government do to make libraries better?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] I believe that they should improve Accessibility [可访问性] for everyone in the city. [Reason] Libraries need modern computers and longer opening hours to serve the community better than they currently do. [Example] If they offer free digital resources, they can boost Literacy [读写能力] rates significantly among poorer students. Investing in public knowledge is always a good strategy for the future growth of society.

part3.question: Which one is better, paper books or e-books?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] From my perspective [视角], paper books are better for deep reading and retention. [Reason] They allow you to focus without digital distractions like notifications, thus improving your Attention span [注意力持续时间]. [Example] Whereas screens hurt your eyes, paper is gentle and helps Imagination [想象力] grow without physical strain. I always prefer the tactile feeling of turning real pages when reading a novel.

part3.question: Why should children listen to bedtime stories?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] It is crucial [至关重要的] because it develops their Imagination [想象力] and vocabulary early in life. [Reason] Stories transport them to magical worlds and teach moral lessons gently before they go to sleep. [Example] Unless they hear stories, they might struggle with Literacy [读写能力] later in school classes. It also creates a strong emotional bond between the parent and the child.

part3.question: Do Chinese children prefer ancient stories or fairy tales?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] Generally speaking, they enjoy both, but modern fairy tales are very popular right now. [Reason] Disney movies have influenced their taste heavily, although parents value Preservation [保存] of traditional culture. [Example] While they watch cartoons, they must also Hit the books [用功读书] to learn ancient myths. It is a mix of global entertainment and local heritage [遗产] education for them.

part3.question: Has the internet reduced the attention span required to read long novels?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] Undoubtedly [毫无疑问地], social media has shortened our Attention span [注意力持续时间] significantly in recent years. [Reason] People are used to quick videos and cannot focus on long texts or deep narratives anymore. [Example] If you are a Bookworm [书呆子], you are rare in today's world of Impulsive [冲动的] clicks and Consumerism [消费主义]. We need to retrain our brains to enjoy slow reading again.

part3.question: Is storytelling an essential part of preserving a culture's history?
part3.model_answer: [Opinion] Absolutely [绝对地], it ensures the Preservation [保存] of traditions and core values for the future. [Reason] Oral history passes down wisdom that you must Read between the lines [读懂言外之意] to understand fully. [Example] Provided that elders tell stories, the younger generation maintains Accessibility [可访问性] to their heritage [遗产] roots. Without stories, we would lose our identity and connection to our ancestors [祖先].
